title: [docs] tensor.add doesn't describe overloads
body_html:
torch.add describes the overloads while tensor.add just has a add(value) function. We should make a note that these overloads exist and possibly redirect to torch.add.

tensor.add docs
torch.add docs

Originally reported here: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/tensor-add-confusing-in-optimizer-code/19876/2
body_text:
torch.add describes the overloads while tensor.add just has a add(value) function. We should make a note that these overloads exist and possibly redirect to torch.add.
tensor.add docs
torch.add docs
Originally reported here: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/tensor-add-confusing-in-optimizer-code/19876/2
body:
`torch.add` describes the overloads while `tensor.add` just has a `add(value)` function. We should make a note that these overloads exist and possibly redirect to `torch.add`.

[tensor.add docs](https://pytorch.org/docs/master/tensors.html?highlight=tensor%20add#torch.Tensor.add)
[torch.add docs](https://pytorch.org/docs/master/torch.html?highlight=torch%20add#torch.add)

Originally reported here: https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/tensor-add-confusing-in-optimizer-code/19876/2
